result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas J Horick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Release for work, work search and treatment if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Restitution for Roundy's to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $400.00 per month starting 09/23/22 and each month thereafter.

No Criminal Contact with Roundy's. No Contact with any supervisors or civilian employees involved in the case. Complete Thinking for a Change. AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Maintain/Obtain a valid Driver's license. Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week). Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Release for work, work search and treatment. To Commence 08/23/22 by 12:00pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas J Horick

defendant.name: Horick, Douglas J
defendant.address: 107 N. Moreland Blvd  Apt 206, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter dated September 29, 2022 from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure, filed by DOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Douglas J Horick in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Douglas J Horick. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State filed an amended information.  Defense acknowledges receipt and waives further reading. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 Months Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  

Term of Probation:1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	Inform agent of all prescriptions;
-	Complete Thinking for Change;
-	Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week);
-	No contact with any supervisors or civilian employees involved in the case;
-	No criminal contact with Roundy's;
-	Maintain/Obtain a valid Driver's License;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License;

Condition Time: 10 Days Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT - To commence 8/23/22 by 12:00 pm.

RESTITUTION: $ 3800.00 to be paid to Roundy's as a condition of probation at a rate of $400.00 per month commencing 9/23/22 and to continue on the 23rd of each month thereafter until paid in full.

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DRGOD Surcharge: $ 10.00 

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 11 months of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:42 AM Defendant Douglas J Horick in court with attorney Tsz-King Tse.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Letter to Judge re: Withdrawing Motion to Modify Bond, filed by Atty. Tse.  **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on May 31, 2022 - APPROVED - Clerk to remove hearing of 6-3-22.**
Bail/bond hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Modify Conditions of Bond

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
